intro: Rhipsalis caripensis, commonly known as the silver star cactus, is a climbing epiphytic cactus native to the tropical regions of South America. It features slender, branched stems that are often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair, giving it a silvery appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming during the rainy season. Its leaves are reduced to small, spine-like structures, and it thrives in bright, indirect light with high humidity. Rhipsalis caripensis is popular as a houseplant due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
